text: what we do is we protect sensitive data
or keys with this concept called moving
target defense something we pioneered
with the Department of Homeland Security
Department of Defense to basically say
today the defense infrastructure it's a
stationary target
so as time goes by it gets easier and
easier for attackers we flip that around
by taking sensitive keys or sensitive
data fragmenting them splitting them up
encrypting the fragments continuously
moving them around across the
distributed system so that as time goes
by it actually gets more difficult to
attack in the cloud you can enable these
new approaches so actually up until
recently moving target defense was
heavily researched in academia and
military was hard to apply it
practically the nice thing about cloud
is there's the flexibility and
scalability where you can create nodes
servers or containers across cloud
environments and actually dynamically
and continuously hop fragments of data
or keys between them re encrypting them
as they move around and they can have
different buckets attached to them for
storage or things like that yeah well so
initially it started out with my
co-founder and our CTO Boris was
developing a distributed programming
language and then this was the killer
application and if you think about
encryption and data protection a lot of
people are concerned that over time it
gets easier and easier to attack you can
do side channel attacks cryptographic
attacks eventually quantum computers and
as you use more and more cloud services
especially the amount of Secrets that
there are to manage is just exploding as
in with IOT as well so there needs to be
a solution for managing secrets keys and
sense of data at scale and so we've
applied our technology to that to
productize it and we've seen a lot of
demand in the market from the federal
sector from some of these agencies as
well as some fortune 100 companies that
we've worked with in the banking
industry and media entertainment and now
actually startups that are starting to
develop cloud infrastructure turning to
us to help them manage all of those
secrets
the first thing we did we have this
technology and we just approached people
CISOs CIOs directors security people and
said hey we have this technology here's
what it does how would it be useful how
would you productize it and it's the
story of taking a foundational
innovation and then actually putting a
form factor around it you think about
other inventions like car batteries for
instance with Tesla they had to come up
with an actual car they can't just sell
the battery right and so the first year
was just trying to map out and
understand people's pain points then we
start getting it into people's hands and
then just seeing what they do with it
and what we found out is people started
using it to protect keys secrets files
different things for cloud
infrastructure and you follow those
signals to develop a product roadmap and
today everyone's focused on threat
detection and network protection you
look at the majority of resources that's
where they go but the challenges is you
move into the cloud is you have services
like AWS the networks are more
distributed they're not necessarily as
trusted and so the future model of
security is going to be data security
and authentication protect the data
protect the keys manage the
authentication and do that in a DevOps
type of environment where you can
essentially build cloud native
applications in untrusted environments
and so that's sort of our bet of where
security will go and if you have a
dynamic infrastructure then you don't
have to worry about detecting the
threats as much
